subject: Investing
title: Market Cap Explained
description: A micro-lesson that makes Market Cap Explained usable.

hook.text: Apple's market cap is $3 trillion. That means the market values all its shares at $3 trillion combined.

buildup.text: Market cap equals share price times total shares outstanding. It's the market's price tag on a company.

discovery.text: Large-cap means over $10 billion. Mid-cap is $2 to $10 billion. Small-cap is under $2 billion.

twist.text: Market cap doesn't mean a company has that much cash. It reflects what investors will pay for its future.

climax.text: A $50 stock with 1 billion shares is bigger than a $500 stock with 10 million shares. Price alone misleads.

punchline.text: Market cap is the company's total price tag. Share price is just one slice.
